VIII.iv.2.A.1.c
.
Reason for Detention or Internment
Generally, the reason for detention or internment is immaterial when making FPOW determinations.
Exception
:  Do not authorize FPOW status if a serviceperson was detained or interned by a foreign government for a violation of its laws.  Such a person is
not
entitled to FPOW status unless the charges were a sham intended to legitimize the detention/internment.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, Chapter 2, Section A - Former Prisoner of War (FPOW) Status
